column3: located in the northwest of the republic on the left bank of the Volga River

column1: The city stands on the site of Mari village. In 1865
column2: the town was referred to as the village Kabachischi (the title area of arable land Paratsky peasants "Kabachischenskie field"). Since 1897 the village was called Paratsky Zaton
column3: and since 1928  working village Green Dol. In 1932

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Zelenodolsk serves as the administrative center of Zelenodolsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of republic significance of Zelenodolsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of republic significance of Zelenodolsk is incorporated within Zelenodolsky Municipal District as Zelenodolsk Urban Settlement.

column2: Zelenodolsk is an important transport hub of the republic. It also has a well-known shipbuilding yard (Zelenodolsk Factory)
